item.title: Select fields in Elasticsearch: _source, fields and stored_fields
item.description: In Elasticsearch, when we index documents to an index, by default the source of the document is stored in meta field _source. When you search your index, you see a special field _source for each matched/hit product.

item.title: Prevent Accidental Index Delete in Elasticsearch
item.description: In Elasticsearch, you can use wildcard in a lot of the index operations. This is very handy, but can be dangerous sometimes, e.g., when you use wildcards when deleting indexes. You may delete unintended indexes accidentally and cause serious interruptions to your business/work.

item.title: Elasticsearch Version Conflict Error
item.description: The version conflict error is often seen when doing document indexing operations in Elasticsearch.

item.title: How to Use the Elasticsearch task API
item.description: In Elasticsearch (ES), you can run a task and check its status with the task API. For example, if you use the reindex API in ES with parameter with_for_completion=False, ES will not wait for the process to finish and will return a task instead.

item.title: LATERAL VIEW EXPLODE in Spark
item.description: For array type column, explode() will convert it to n rows, where n is the number of elements in the array. For map/dictionary type column, explode() will convert it to nx2 shape, i.e., n rows, 2 columns (for key and value).

item.title: Learning SQL from Scratch(1): Do We Even Need to Start?
item.description:
As a machine learning engineer who mainly deals with vision-based projects, I have little opportunity in my work to actually use SQL (Structured Query Language.). Even when I need it, I often just ask the data engineers for a favor.

However, I thought it would be an essential skill to learn even if I do not need it for now.
